From: "Daniel Paul Hightower" <dph_of_rules@...>

> The thing with laying bombs or other weapons/items on the ground is 
game
> engine related, you can try to put them in the editor (or if it 
won't let
> you, convert to a text file, put them in the objects section, bump 
the
> number of objects up, and convert it to a scenario file) and see 
what
> happens.  I believe it has something to do with it's state and who 
planted
> it, but I'm not sure (it was in a previous message when someone 
asked about
> some odd error that popped up in game).

That was me [a long time ago] about leaving something in the scenario 
that didn't belong.  I've tried leaving (high level) faerie sprinkles 
on slime and they've had no effect and not caused error messages.  I'm 
convinced that you shouldn't be allowed to plant weapons in a scenario 
 if they're not going to do any good.  Perhaps, Tom Ricket might be 
able to explain how we could plant weapons in a scenario and those 
weapons do something.

Incidently, I'll be starting the Adoption of Proposed Tournament Rules 
tomorrow.
